b1.title: Navigating User Levels
b1.description: Understanding and moving between different command modes in Cisco IOS.

commands.explanation: Moves from User EXEC mode to Privileged EXEC mode.
Moves from Privileged EXEC mode to Global Configuration mode.
Moves back one level in the command hierarchy.

commands.step: Return to Privileged EXEC Mode from any sub-config mode
commands.explanation: Returns directly to Privileged EXEC mode.

b2.title: Hostname
b2.description: Setting a unique name for the network device.

commands.explanation: You must be in global config mode to change the hostname.
Changes the device's name to 'R1'. The prompt will update immediately.

b3.title: Banner motd/message
b3.description: Configure a Message of the Day (MOTD) banner that displays to anyone logging into the device.

commands.explanation: Access global configuration mode.

commands.command:
banner motd #
Enter your banner message here. End with the '#' character.
#
commands.explanation: Sets a banner. The '#' is a delimiting character; you can use any character not in your message.

b4.title: Enable Password
b4.description: Setting a password to protect access to Privileged EXEC mode.

commands.explanation: Sets a clear-text password. Use 'enable secret' for better security.
Sets a strongly encrypted password for privileged mode. This overrides the 'enable password' if both are set.

b5.title: Line console password
b5.description: Securing the physical console port with a password.

commands.explanation: Enters configuration mode for the console port.
Sets the password for console access.
Prompts for the password upon console connection.

b6.title: Line VTY password
b6.description: Securing virtual terminal lines used for remote access (Telnet/SSH).

commands.explanation: Enters configuration mode for the first 5 virtual terminal lines.
Sets the password for VTY access.
Prompts for the password on remote connections. For SSH, use 'login local'.

b7.title: Exec timeout
b7.description: Configuring the idle timeout for console and VTY lines.

commands.explanation: Enters configuration mode for the console port.
Sets the timeout to 5 minutes and 30 seconds. 'exec-timeout 0 0' disables timeout.

b8.title: Logging Synchronous
b8.description: Prevents console messages from interrupting your command typing.

commands.explanation: Enters configuration mode for the console port.
Ensures console messages don't split your typed commands.

b9.title: Disabling IP domain lookup
b9.description: Prevents the router from trying to resolve mistyped commands as hostnames.

commands.explanation: Stops the device from attempting to translate unknown commands via DNS.

b10.title: IP domain name
b10.description: Sets the domain name for the device, required for generating RSA keys for SSH.

commands.explanation: Assigns a domain name to the device.

b11.title: Username and password
b11.description: Creating a local user database for authentication.

commands.explanation: Creates a user 'admin' with an encrypted password 'cisco'.

b12.title: Encrypting all passwords
b12.description: Encrypts all clear-text passwords in the running configuration.

commands.explanation: Applies weak encryption to all current and future clear-text passwords.

b13.title: Set Current Clock Time
b13.description: Manually setting the system clock on a device.

commands.explanation: Sets the system time. This is done in Privileged EXEC mode.

b14.title: Set management IP Address - SW
b14.description: Configuring an IP address on a Switch Virtual Interface (SVI) for management.

commands.explanation: Enters the configuration for the default management SVI.
Sets the IP address and subnet mask.
Activates the SVI.

b15.title: Prevent Brute-force Attack - Router
b15.description: Configuring login attempt limits to mitigate brute-force attacks.

commands.explanation: Blocks logins for 120 seconds if 3 failed attempts occur within 60 seconds.
Logs failed login attempts.
